findings.title: Missing Security Header: Strict-Transport-Security
findings.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) ensures the browser only connects via HTTPS.
findings.remediation: Add 'Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload' header to all HTTPS responses.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: Content-Security-Policy
findings.description: Content Security Policy (CSP) helps prevent XSS attacks by controlling which resources can be loaded.
findings.remediation: Implement a Content-Security-Policy header with appropriate directives for your application.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: X-Frame-Options
findings.description: X-Frame-Options prevents clickjacking attacks by controlling whether the page can be embedded in frames.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: X-Content-Type-Options
findings.remediation: Add 'X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff' header to all responses.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: X-XSS-Protection
findings.description: X-XSS-Protection enables browser's XSS filter (note: deprecated in favor of CSP).
findings.remediation: Add 'X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block' header. Better: use Content-Security-Policy.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: Referrer-Policy
findings.description: Referrer-Policy controls how much referrer information is shared with requests.

findings.title: Missing Security Header: Permissions-Policy
findings.description: Permissions-Policy controls which browser features can be used.
findings.remediation: Add 'Permissions-Policy' header to restrict unnecessary browser features.

findings.title: Server Version Disclosure in Headers
findings.description: The Server header reveals software version information.
findings.remediation: Configure the web server to suppress or obfuscate version information in the Server header.

findings.title: HTTP Only - No SSL/TLS
findings.description: The application is served over HTTP without encryption. All traffic is transmitted in clear text.
findings.remediation: Implement HTTPS with a valid SSL/TLS certificate. Redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS.

findings.title: No SQL Injection Detected
findings.description: No obvious SQL injection vulnerabilities were detected in basic testing.
findings.evidence: Error-based SQL injection payloads did not trigger database errors
findings.remediation: This does not guarantee absence of SQL injection. Perform comprehensive testing with advanced techniques.

findings.title: Sensitive File Accessible: phpinfo.php
findings.remediation: Remove or restrict access to 'phpinfo.php'. Configure web server to deny access to sensitive files.
